lead_paragraph: HSBC said Monday that its earnings had doubled in the first half of the year, as its American unit returned to profit and provisions for bad loans dropped to the lowest level since the start of the financial crisis, Julia Werdigier reports in The New York Times.
snippet: HSBC said Monday that its earnings had doubled in the first half of the year, as its American unit returned to profit and provisions for bad loans dropped to the lowest level since the start of the financial crisis.

headline.main: Strong Results From HSBC and BNP
